participant_id.Description: Unique BIDS identifier for the participant in this study.

IPRI_01.LongName: I daydream and fantasize, with some regularity, about things that might happen to me.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_02.LongName: I often have tender, concerned feelings for people less fortunate than me.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_03.LongName: I sometimes find it difficult to see things from the "other guy's" point of view.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_04.LongName: Sometimes I don't feel very sorry for other people when they are having problems.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_05.LongName: I really get involved with the feelings of the characters in a novel.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_06.LongName: In emergency situations, I feel apprehensive and ill-at-ease.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_07.LongName: I am usually objective when I watch a movie or play, and I don't often get completely caught up in it.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_08.LongName: I try to look at everybody's side of a disagreement before I make a decision.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_9.LongName: When I see someone being taken advantage of, I feel kind of protective towards them.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_10.LongName: I sometimes feel helpless when I am in the middle of a very emotional situation.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_11.LongName: I sometimes try to understand my friends better by imagining how things look from their perspective.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_12.LongName: Becoming extremely involved in a good book or movie is somewhat rare for me.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_13.LongName: When I see someone get hurt, I tend to remain calm.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_14.LongName: Other people's misfortunes do not usually disturb me a great deal.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_15.LongName: If I'm sure I'm right about something, I don't waste much time listening to other people's arguments.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_16.LongName: After seeing a play or movie, I have felt as though I were one of the characters.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_17.LongName: Being in a tense emotional situation scares me.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_18.LongName: When I see someone being treated unfairly, I sometimes don't feel very much pity for them.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_19.LongName: I am usually pretty effective in dealing with emergencies.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_20.LongName: I am often quite touched by things that I see happen.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_21.LongName: I believe that there are two sides to every question and try to look at them both.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_22.LongName: I would describe myself as a pretty soft-hearted person.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_23.LongName: When I watch a good movie, I can very easily put myself in the place of a leading character.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_24.LongName: I tend to lose control during emergencies.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_25.LongName: When I'm upset at someone, I usually try to "put myself in his shoes" for a while.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_26.LongName: When I am reading an interesting story or novel, I imagine how I would feel if the events in the story were happening to me.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_27.LongName: When I see someone who badly needs help in an emergency, I go to pieces.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_28.LongName: Before criticizing somebody, I try to imagine how I would feel if I were in their place.

Levels.0: A - DOES NOT DESCRIBE ME WELL

IPRI_29.Description: The Perspective Taking (PT) scale assesses the tendency to spontaneously adopt the psychological point of view of others (e.g. “When I am upset at someone, I usually try to ‘put myself in his shoes’ for a while.”). Sum of scores of items 8, 11, 21, 25, 28 and reverse scores of items 3, 15. | Calculation = revscore([IPRI_03])+[IPRI_08]+revscore([IPRI_15])+[IPRI_21]+[IPRI_25]+[IPRI_28]

IPRI_30.Description: The Fantasy Scale (FS) assesses the tendency to imaginatively transpose oneself into the feelings and actions of fictitious characters in books, movies, and plays (e.g. “I really get involved with the feelings of the characters in a novel.”). Sum of scores of items 1, 5, 16, 23, 26 and reverse scores of items 7, 12. | Calculation = [IPRI_01]+[IPRI_05]+revscore([IPRI_07])+revscore([IPRI_12])+[IPRI_16]+[IPRI_23]+[IPRI_26]

IPRI_31.Description: The Empathic Concern (EC) scale measures other-oriented feelings of sympathy and concern for others in distress (e.g. “When I see someone being taken advantage of, I feel kind of protective towards them.”). Sum of scores of items 2, 9, 20, 22 and reverse scores of items 4, 14, 18. | Calculation = [IPRI_02]+revscore([IPRI_04])+[IPRI_9]+revscore([IPRI_14])+revscore([IPRI_18])+[IPRI_20]+[IPRI_22]

IPRI_32.Description: The Personal Distress (PD) scale assesses self-oriented anxiety when experiencing others in distress (e.g. “In emergency situations, I feel apprehensive and ill-at-ease.”). Sum of scores of items 6, 10, 17, 24, 27 and reverse scores of items 13, 19. | Calculation = [IPRI_06]+[IPRI_10]+[IPRI_11]+revscore([IPRI_13])+[IPRI_17]+revscore([IPRI_19])+[IPRI_24]+[IPRI_27]
